paper_title.ja: About Resonance
paper_title.en: About Resonance

description.ja: his introduction to the special issue of Inter Faculty, volume 10,takes up the theme of resonance in the context of the Covid-19 pandemic and itsensuing societal shifts. It gives a short commentary ofthe individual studies presented here, placing them within the wider consideration of theplanet-wideturning point facinghumanity in relation to the naturalworld.

description.ja: This introduction to Volume 9 ofInter Facultytakes up the theme of patterns of confluence and influence in the context of movements of history. From this perspective, it gives a commentary on each individual study as well as a short observation on the concept of ‘mother’ language.

paper_title.ja: About Fragmentation and Divergence
paper_title.en: About Fragmentation and Divergence

description.ja: This introduction to volume 7ofInter Facultytraces the reasoningand objectives fortaking the theme of Fragmentation and Divergenceas the focus of discussion. It takes a close look at the discussionsproperand their outcome. In considering the issues taken up here, theintroduction underscores the complexity of the systems that make up the present globalised world (economical, political, social, cultural) and questions the role of research in human and social sciences, highlighting the importance of articulatingthe phenomena of mankind and his existence and those of nature.
description.en: This introduction to volume 7ofInter Facultytraces the reasoningand objectives fortaking the theme of Fragmentation and Divergenceas the focus of discussion. It takes a close look at the discussionsproperand their outcome. In considering the issues taken up here, theintroduction underscores the complexity of the systems that make up the present globalised world (economical, political, social, cultural) and questions the role of research in human and social sciences, highlighting the importance of articulatingthe phenomena of mankind and his existence and those of nature.

description.ja: 21世紀は20世紀という「むさぼり」の時代から新たな「協働」の時代への転換期である。過去において日本は転換期のつど新たな思想を展開した。例えば仏教を受容した聖徳太子の時代、菅原道真から紀貫之にいたる「古今和歌集」の時代、親鸞、日蓮に代表される鎌倉仏教の時代、近代儒学から本居宣長に至る近世の思想、明治維新をめぐる「和魂洋才」の時代。そして日清・日露戦争に象徴される「坂の上の雲」の時代。戦後の民主教育と高度経済成長時代。そして、今である。それぞれの転換期において日本人は（東）アジア的な学問・芸術・文化・思想を基盤にしつつ、そこに立脚して、革新を行ってきた。日本人の心性（和魂）は儒学的、道教的、仏教的、神道的要素を多重に刷り込みながら形成されてきた。その中で今の私たちまでつながる最も大事業と呼べるのは19世紀末から20世紀初頭にかけての嘉納治五郎（1860‐1938）の体育教育、上田万年（1867‐1937）の国語教育（言語教
description.en:
Ten years have passed since the beginning of the 21st Century. This period has been a turning point from the grasping materialism of the 20th century to a new age of cooperation. At just such turning points, throughout its history, Japan has developed new ideas and new ways of thinking. For example: the introduction of Buddhism during the reign of Prince Shotoku; the evolution of poetry throughout the times of Michizane Sugawara and Kino Tsurayuki, as can be seen in the Kokin-wakashu (Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry); the introduction of Kamakura Buddhism developed by Shinran and Nichiren; the growth of modern philosophy influenced by modern Confucianism and Norinaga Motoori’s Kokugaku (Japanese philology and philosophy); the evolution of Wakonyousai (Japanese spirit and western learning) during the Meiji Restoration. Then there were the periods of the Sino-Japanese and Russo-Japanese wars as portrayed in Saka no Ue no Kumo, and the new period of democratic education and rapid economic growth that followed the Second World War. Today, we are at another such turning point. 

At each turning point, the Japanese people have faced the challenge to innovate and to evo
